page.title: 06ALDINGHAM SCHOOL, SCALES
page.content: Aldingham Parochial School is situated in Scales.Originally it was a tithe barn and was converted in 1875. Mrs.A. Young,is head, Mrs.A.Woods ass.teacher and Mrs.C.Whalley 0.8teacher.Forty six children attend,from, Gleaston,Scales, Sunbrick,Newbiggin,Baycliffe,Bardsea and Aldingham. Infants who live over 2 miles away,and juniors 3 miles,come by mini bus. and travel free, others pay Â£2 per week. Scales children walk. The cloakroom is 3mx2.5m and houses up to 50 childrens'posessions.The large classroom is 8mx7.9m, 35 children are taught here,7yrs.and under and 9yrs. and under by two teachers. The small classroom is 5.6mx4.6m, 20 children are taught here, 11yrs, and under.Mrs. A.Price is caretaker/dinner lady. She serves about 35 hot lunches daily which are cooked at Croftlands School Ulverston. Servery is 5.7mx2m.
